All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractInterruptingJedisLock
    Abstract class base to interrupting locks It carries most of the code, and the thread generation is in the descendants
    HScanIterable
    Iterable for hmap entries Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty map) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    HScanIterator
    Iterator scan for the keys of a hmap Only one use for an instace of this class Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty map) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    IJedisLock
    Interface for locks on redis
    InterruptingJedisJedisLockBase
    This interrupting lock will create a background thread into the class This is the preferred method for the interrupting locks
    InterruptingJedisJedisLockExecutor
    This class will use a executor to get a thread to wait for lease time to go zero CAUTION: the executor can prevent the interrupting operation to be launched, be aware not to use an exhausted pool For this reason, is recommended a cached thread pool, which will create bew threads on demand or will use old ones if avalible For example, with Executors.newCachedThreadPool()
    JedisAdvancedCountDownLatch Deprecated.
    JedisAdvancedSemaphore Deprecated.
    JedisCountDownLatch
    Jedis implemetation of a CountDownLatch It makes some threads, in one or many different processes, wait until its counter reaches zero.
    JedisList
    A Jedis-based implementation of a List interface backed on Redis list on server The goal is to comply with the List interface specification by using Redis/Jedis directly and getting data for server in every operation with no local data in the class (or mininum as possible).
    JedisLock
    Class that will perform a lock based on Redis locks It is also closeable to be used in try-with-resources I do not recommend reuse a locked-and-unlocked JedisLock Should be thread-safe, I do not recomend using between thread s https://redis.io/topics/distlock
    JedisLockUtils  
    JedisMap  
    JedisPoolAdapter
    This class creates a new 'pool' of redis connections from only one existing connection.
    JedisSemaphore
    A redis/jedis implementation of a Java semaphore that is distributed over various processes/threads It works like a semaphore, but the semaphore counter is stored in redis and operated by all the threads/processes that use the same name (on the same server of course ) A semaphore is identified and shared by its name The first semaphore that is created in redis assings the intial permits to the redis shared value.
    JedisSet  
    Lock
    java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock from a Redis Lock
    ScanIterable
    Iterable for redis entries Jedis pool connection is required If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    ScanIterator
    Iterator scan for the keys of the redis database Only one use for an instace of this class Jedis pool connection is required If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    ScanUtil
    This class can help with the key scanning It can use a pool or a single connection Also, it can return a list or execute a method for each result CAUTION: in the last mode, REDIS specifies that a SCAN operation can return duplicates this is very rare but possible, your code must handle it or be aware of this https://redis.io/commands/scan The list result has filtered duplicates NOTE: feel free to contribute adding HSCAN, SSCAN, ZSCAN
    SScanIterable
    Iterable for sset entries Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty set) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    SScanIterator
    Iterator for sset entries Only one use for an instace of this class Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty set) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    ZScanIterable
    Iterable for zset entries (ordered set) Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty set) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
    ZScanIterator
    Iterator for zset entries Only one use for an instace of this class Jedis pool connection is required Name of the element on redis is required (if not exists, it acts like as called for an empty set) If no pattern is provided, all elements are retrieves interactively If no results per call to redis, it tries with 1 Can return duplicated results, but is rare
